text: Pope Anastasius IV (; c.1073-3 December 1154), born Corrado di Suburra,Some sources give his name as Corrado Demetri della Suburra was an Italian cleric of the Roman Catholic Church."Anastasius IV," Encyclopedia Britannica (2012); retrieved 2012-8-27. He was the 169th Pope from 1153 until his death in 1154. "List of Popes," Catholic Encyclopedia (2009); retrieved 2012-8-27. ==Early life== Corrado di Suburra was born in Rome."Pope Anastasius IV", Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-8-27. He was the son of Benedetto di Suburra.Cardinals of the Holy Roman Church], Corrado di Suburra ; retrieved 2012-8-27. ==Cardinal== In 1127, della Suburra was made cardinal-bishop of Sabina. ==Pope== Anastasius was elected pope in July 1153. "Anastasius," Encyclopedia Britannica (1911); retrieved 2012-8-27. He is known for helping to settle a controversy between the Holy Roman Emperor and the Bishop of Magdeburg in Germany.Bunson, Matthew. (2004). OSV's Encyclopedia of Catholic History, pp. 74-75. The Pantheon in Rome was restored while he was pope. The pope died on 3 December 1154. ==Related pages== * List of popes ==References== ==Other websites== * * Cardinals of the Holy Roman Church , Corrado di Suburra Category:Italian popes Category:1073 births Category:1154 deaths
